title: US President Donald Trump says Venezuela airspace to be shut ‘in its entirety’ as tensions rise

description: US President Donald Trump has declared Venezuelan airspace entirely closed to all airlines, pilots, drug dealers, and human traffickers. This move follows new US measures against alleged Venezuelan drug-trafficking networks, with ground strikes planned soon.  The US has also designated President Maduro and associates as a foreign terrorist organization, expanding sanctions authority.

He attributed these outcomes to "Strong Leadership and TARIFFS," as tariff revenues have significantly increased, with a Supreme Court ruling on presidential authority pending.

title: Vanessa Bryant turns Disneyland into family adventure as daughters shine
description: Vanessa Bryant recently shared a heartwarming glimpse of a Disneyland outing with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri on Instagram. The philanthropist has been a steadfast presence for her girls, balancing their needs with her own grief. Bryant expressed immense pride in Natalia's resilience and maturity, highlighting her role as a supportive big sister and daughter.

title: 'This is Virat, mayday': Ukraine 'claims' strike on two Russian oil tankers
description: A Russian oil tanker, the Virat, was struck by an unmanned vessel in the Black Sea near the Turkish coast, with explosions reported. Another vessel, the Kairos, also experienced an explosion. In footage of a crew member aboard Virat, a man reports it to be a drone attack in panic. Ukrainian sources have claimed responsibility, stating they targeted the ships for allegedly transporting sanctioned Russian oil.

After causing significant devastation and over 150 deaths in Sri Lanka, the storm's approach has prompted widespread evacuations, flight cancellations, and school closures across southern Indian states. Relief efforts are underway, with authorities on high alert.

The news was met with widespread congratulations from fans and notable figures across sports, including LeBron James and Caitlin Clark. This happy milestone follows her brother Sebastian Korda's recent engagement.

title: Rupee seen stabilising after 4% slide this year; traders eye India–US deal for next cues
description: The Indian rupee is unlikely to see a sharp fall soon, having already depreciated 4% this year and trading in a narrow band. Union Bank of India anticipates the rupee to remain range-bound between 88.80 and 89.50 through December, with potential strengthening contingent on equity inflows or progress on the India-US BTA.

title: 'Beating India... one of the best': Babar stokes fire; brags about Pakistan's win as captain
description: Pakistan captain Babar Azam cherishes the historic 2021 World Cup victory against India in Dubai as his most treasured moment.  He revealed seeking insights from top cricketers like Virat Kohli on preparation and mental discipline.  Azam emphasized that this monumental win, Pakistan's first against India in a World Cup, remains unparalleled in his career.

He will play three matches for Baroda in the Syed Musthaq Ali Trophy, starting December 2nd. This stint aims to ease him back into action before the T20Is against South Africa, ensuring he's match-fit for next year's T20 World Cup.

title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency: Death toll tops 132 with 176 still missing
description: Sri Lanka declared a state of emergency as Cyclone Ditwah's rains and floods claimed 132 lives and left 176 missing. Over 15,000 homes were destroyed, forcing 78,000 into shelters. The nation seeks international aid, with India already dispatching relief supplies and reaffirming support.

First Australian PM wedding in 124 years: Albanese marries Haydon — in pics
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese married his partner Jodie Haydon in a private ceremony at The Lodge in Canberra, becoming the first sitting leader to do so in the nation's federal history. Around 60 close family and friends attended the civil wedding, with their dog Toto as ring bearer. The couple expressed delight in sharing their commitment with loved ones.

description: A wedding in Hardoi turned tragic when a dispute over music led to a fatal shooting. Akhilesh Gautam allegedly ordered his brother Akash to shoot Puttulal, the father of a DJ, after the music stopped. Puttulal was shot and died at the hospital. Akhilesh has been arrested for murder.

The return of Rama: A 500-year-old struggle that restored the prince of Ayodhya
description: Ayodhya's 500-year Ram Janmabhoomi struggle culminated on January 22, 2024, with the consecration of the Ram Lalla temple. This event marked the physical manifestation of faith, fulfilling a centuries-long aspiration. The journey, from Maharishi Valmiki's depiction of Ram's exile to modern movements and legal battles, finally saw the temple stand as a reclaimed heritage.

The offensive posts, targeting her after a performance at the Kolkata Film Festival, allegedly involved body shaming and defamation. Police are investigating, tracing the Facebook page and a linked mobile number.

Sekhon, linked to ISI operative Harry Chatha, confessed the gang threatened to kill Sharma if demands weren't met. The cafe faced three shootings, with footage circulated to amplify threats. Sekhon's arrest followed a trail from a missing pistol.

In 2023, 715 deaths occurred on Haryana's NH-44 alone, a grim statistic reflecting a national road safety crisis exacerbated by speeding, design flaws, and inadequate infrastructure.

title: Inside the deal-making power of the F-35: A weapon, a network, a strategic lock-in
description: The F-35 is the United States’ one of the strongest bargaining chip because it is irreplaceable — no rival offers its stealth maturity, network warfare capability or global support infrastructure. Nations that qualify to fly it join the most advanced military ecosystem in existence; those excluded remain outside the intelligence-fusion loop that defines modern air combat.

Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Neurosurgeon with 25 years of experience shares 10 habits that make the brain smarter
description: Neuroscience reveals that consistent habits can reshape the brain, enhancing thinking, learning, and stress resilience. AIIMS-trained Neurosurgeon Dr. Arun L Naik shares 10 key habits, from consistent sleep to daily learning, that stimulate neural circuits and foster a smarter brain. Practicing these daily leads to sharper recall and peak performance.

title: Perez Hilton reacts as Meghan Markle accused of keeping $1,700 photoshoot gown
description: A resurfaced rumor about Meghan Markle taking a designer gown without permission, dubbed "Green Gown-gate," has sparked debate. Podcaster Perez Hilton defended Meghan, calling the claims "nonsense." Meanwhile, Meghan and Prince Harry actively participated in a Thanksgiving meal packing event through their Archewell Foundation, offering a positive counterpoint to the dress controversy.

title: 'Content is king': Kevin O’Leary advices students; claims creators earn biggest paydays
description: Shark Tank investor Kevin O'Leary has reversed his advice to students, now highlighting creative storytelling and content creation as the fastest-growing wage earners. He stated that elite content creators are achieving significant incomes by driving online sales and reducing customer acquisition costs, a stark contrast to his previous emphasis on engineering degrees.

title: US tariffs: Mark Carney tells Canadians; Levies will wipe $50 billion from Canada's economy
description: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is rolling back climate rules and encouraging pipeline construction to boost the energy sector amidst US tariff uncertainty. This move aims to diversify oil exports and reduce reliance on the US market, though it sparks internal government tensions and environmentalist criticism.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers eye $186M Bucks star as they plan league’s next superteam
description: Whispers are growing louder about the Los Angeles Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo.  Reports suggest the franchise is exploring aggressive moves to build a future around Luka Dončić, even considering significant short-term sacrifices.  Complex multi-team trade scenarios are circulating, aiming to reshape multiple NBA rosters and create new championship contenders.
